review: i loveeee cpk! i use to go all the time back in high school at short hills mall but havent been since now! i LOVE the chipotle pizza and their spinach artichoke dip with chips; however i spiced things up and got the chicken tequila fettuccine pasta!!! it was definitely a little but pricer than i wished it to be but it was soooo good and abundant so i was able to eat it for lunch the next day as well.  the customer service was good as well so no complaints there, and there was a lot of seating so all of the church members and i were able to seat with no problem!  highly recommend people to go and check it out! they're especially good with fundraisers so if you have a cause you want to raise awareness for, go here!!!

This was the worst CPK I've ever been to. Let's start off with the fact that after I finished eating, there was a roach I had to kill; it was crawling on my bag sitting on top of the bar counter.  Note* This incident took place on a Monday afternoon.  Before that disastrous ordeal, I started off with a lunch combo of a chicken meatball piadina with a mediterranean salad. This was the meal I settled for after being informed that they were out of stock of the seasonal short ribs & mac meal (which I had my heart set on). The piadina and salad were okay except for the fact that the dressing that came with my salad was weird and orange, I'm pretty sure that wasn't the dressing it was suppose to come with. I was too hungry to notice sooner. Then before I left, I ordered a bahn mi bowl to go. Now home, I've noticed that I got the same weird orange dressing for the bowl when it was supposed to come with a chilli-lime vinaigrette! What a huge, disappointing difference this dressing would make, if I decide to even eat the bowl after seeing that roach on the bar counter! What a waste of $30 dollars.  The only positive thing I have to say is that the staff seemed friendly and my beehive sangria was delicious.

We were very favorably impressed, with CPK. So I'll break down our review, and you'll understand why only three stars. Service. The service was excellent! From the time we walked in the door, to the time we left, service was pleasant, attentive, and prompt, but never intrusive. It's the kind of service that makes you want to come back. Ambiance. CPK is a very pleasant place to dine. It's roomy, very clean, well-kept, light and airy. The food. This is where CPK fell, from five stars to three. I ordered the pizza Margherita, and I was surprised at the excessive amount of pizza cheese. Normally, excessive cheese would be a good thing for most. But on a pizza Margherita, the cheese should be sparse, and the mozzarella should be fresh, rather than sliced pizza cheese. I found the pizza Margherita to be overly oily and heavy. I also ordered the buffalo cauliflower. I have had this dish both at home and in other restaurants, but at CPK the cauliflower appears to have been batter coated and fried, and then dressed with buffalo sauce. Again, I found it to be overly oily and heavy. The one bright spot, was the ultimate Bloody Marys. It was very well-crafted, with just the right amount of spice, but not too hot. The garnishes were interesting;  however, the mozzarella in the garnish should have been fresh, not sliced pizza cheese. We do intend to return however, and next time I will probably choose a much lighter version of the fare that I enjoyed this time.

Ever since Blaze Pizza opened I've had no desire to EVER go back to CPK .... But it was happy hour. I wanted some food and drinks. I forgot how great CPK is , especially those avocado rolls , which I definitely had. Along with the tostada pizza w grilled chicken ... It's still as good as I remember it.  Also I got the cocktail sampler , it was a no brainer .... 3 drinks for the price of 1 ...  That's what I'm talking about.. Why 3 stars because our waitress was noticeably having a bad day - I mean I know we all have bad days we are only human ...  But her attitude was so evident that it almost rubbed off on me (I did say almost got me in a bad mood)... Thank goodness for those drinks. And my happy hour didn't turn into sour hour.
I've always loved CPK.  PROS: food is always good, portions decent, server attentive CONS: "clean" table was sticky & prices are always up every time I go

I was honestly surprised at how delicious the food is here: had the guacamole appetizer, and it was chunky (not mushy), which I loved. The crispy mac and cheese small plate was tasty, but not my cup of tea. Moroccan spiced chicken salad was delicious (although I would have added olives, haha), and so were the two pasta dishes. Yeah, it was a lot of food... how else am I supposed to maintain my girlish figure?

Ordered take out. Avocado egg rolls. Delicious. Nicole the manager placed my order.  I was told my food would be ready in 10 minutes. Took a while longer. Nicole offered me a complimentary beverage and apologized for the wait. I appreciated that. CPK is known for there original hand tossed crust, Nicole says and I quote the best , so you have to try the "original BBQ chicken pizza". They also have crispy thin crust pizza for anyone who enjoys thin. The menu stats the Sicilian pizza. Going to try that next.

I rarely give two stars to any place that I dine in. I rather not even leave a review but I must say this night my family and I experienced the worst service. Fast forward, our food comes and before I realized we had no utensils our waitress disappears into the abyss.  After staring at my food for a minute or two and feeling Hangry my little one quickly walked over to the other table and got us 2 of 4 utensils sets. OK deeeep breeeath, WoooooSaaaaaa..... I looked over to my wife and daughters dish and realize there was no fettuccine Alfredo sauce in the dish. Ummm is this CPKs version of fettuccine Alfredo??  Anyway, moving on to what was just the beginning. Our waitress comes back and I tell her we had to take utensils from the other table but needed more. In the same breath I asked for more fettuccine sauce for two of the 4 dishes and more butter for another. Yeap, that requires her to make multiple trips back to the kitchen. Although she was polite and complied I could sense she would rather disappear back into the abyss.  Ok..ok...Let me concentrate and talk about the only good part of my night. It was my dish, Chicken Piccata, pasta with capers was actually delish!!! It allowed me to gather my thoughts enough to relax long enough to enjoy a few bites.  Now back to the madness, I got no refills of my glass of water nor was I asked. Never received the additional silverware we needed, classic waitressing 101.. What some details can change your entire dining experiencing. Not to mention we went here because my daughter chose it for her birthday dinner. So my wife towards the end asks me if were gonna get a dessert for my daughter and mention its her birthday in hopes they would come out with a candle and a quick Happy Birthday song BUT I quickly looked at my wife and said that I refused to ask because I was just so disturbed by the waitress and lack of service and good food. Did I mention we also ordered a $5 personal pizza from the kids menu and it came out with pale doughy dough. ( Big Sigh ) It simply wasn't our night so thanks CPK for hell of a night.

I went here for late lunch. The food was okayish and service was very poor. We ordered the spicy buffalo cauliflower which was good, could have been better though. The cauliflower was a little tough to bite into. The tortilla spring rolls were really good, good portion size. The salad was horrible. It says roasted veggies salad - there were barely any roasted veggies on it. Hated the salad. We sat on the table we got our food and then had to request the server to get cutlery. We got napkins and cutlery after 5 mins. So we were waiting there staring at our food. Then we got our salad and the dressing with no serving spoons. So again had to wait for them to get some spoons. Horrible service.

We went here for lunch and I was pleasantly surprised by the new additions to their menu. They now have some healthy-ish and tasty vegetarian options.  We had the fried mac n cheese, wild mushroom strozzapreti and a tostada pizza. Except for the fried m&c, everything was prepared well and tasted good.  Service was prompt and pleasant. Will be back here  to try out other eats!

This review has to do solely with service. I just walked out, which is maybe the second time in my life that I felt compelled to leave a restaurant for having a staff that doesn't care. Sat there for 5-10 minutes in a half full restaurant and had no one except for the hostess acknowledge us. This used to be the best staff at any CPK. I don't know what happened. Even when we were walking out no one really said anything. I guess they are doing so well they don't need customers.

I know. It's mind-blowing that, despite all the pizza options I have at my disposal in Jersey, I wound up here. But every now and then, I get a craving for this stuff. And whenever I'm at the Willowbrook Mall, which isn't very often, CPK comes calling my name. I'd play it safe and go with the original BBQ chicken pizza, or any of their pizzas for that matter. Very tasty, and the order came out fast. Service was friendly too. Avoid their attempts at creativity and stick to the word that's in the business name and you'll leave content.
*Waitress slams napkins down on table* "I'll be back in 5 minutes to take your order" *walks away*  Me: *walks out*

Great service and great food. Drinks are just the right strength too. Ambiance is great and the variety of dishes offered is excellent just like other CPKs. The Fish Tacos are my #1 pick for CPK. Flavorful and fresh and paired with a nice salsa as well. Another favorite of mine is the Kung Pao Spaghetti. Packed with a lot of flavor with a nice kick too.

My daughter and I shopped and decided to eat here. She ordered the BBQ chicken pizza which was delicious. I believe the red onions enhanced the flavor of the pizza. I ordered fish tacos. They were very tasty by the way. I could have done without the chips and salsa side. The server was nice but not very attentive. We waited for a while to receive things we asked for like napkins and the check. Otherwise, I would have given this place 4 stars

I stopped by here the other day cause I was in the mood for something a little different. CPK has pretty good reviews so I figured hey, why not.          First off I'm a little bias against pizza chains, being from jersey my Italian options are endless. I couldn't help but feel a little disappointed here. The lunch special was alright, the price was affordable and the service has quick & attentive. Though the pizza was average. The decor seems upscale as if this place would be great to bring a lunch date and a few cocktails. Though I think if you're visiting this mall you're better off at the food court or the Cheesecake Factory.

Food and service is great. We got a table right away even though it was pretty busy. Great atmosphere. Good food. Great service.  Boyfriend recommended this place and I don't know why I haven't tried it sooner! Highly recommend.  Will be coming back here.

Very disappointed in this location. The grilled chicken on my salad was undercooked. We told the waiter. About 5 minutes later the manager came over and apologized. Waited another 20 minutes (while my dinner partner finished her meal) before it came back. Was cooked very nicely. When the bill came they deducted a couple of dollars. Not good enough! Asked for the manager again, a different one came over and kindly removed the charge from the bill.

We ordered: 1) the Tricolore Salad Pizza which is spring mix salad with tomatoes atop honey caramelized parmesan pizza crust, drizzled with dijon balsamic vinaigrette and shaved parmesan, and 2) half a Cobb Salad, big enough for dinner and fresh!  Good choices and we would return, for sure.

This was my first time at a CPK and I was impressed by the quality of pizza. We were seated right away on a Friday night even though it was pretty crowded.  My boyfriend and I ordered pizzas and shared. We got the mushroom pepperoni sausage and the margherita. Both had nice fresh ingredients, especially compared to other chains, but being next to NYC definitely isn't going to compare to pizza there. The pizzas are too big really for one person though they call them personal, so it's a decent size if you want leftovers. Who doesn't want leftover pizza? They defintitely have some interesting favors I am intrigued to try.

It's California Pizza Kitchen so what do you really expect?  Ok food and service every time I've dined there.  Their Pizza is pretty solid but their pasta dishes are a bit on the "blah"/mediocre side.

Why did I order taco carnitas? Call me a "genius" Bartender was nice but the tacos didn't taste so nice Stick to pizza here? Sure, if you happen to be in the mall and desperate for food Wood Fired pizza gets me in the mood Were the carnitas bland? No, it was too salty if you ask me  The green sauce was off, nothing flamboyant in my mouth. The top shelf Long Island Ice Tea, had me on my knees. Impressed by the cocktail at CPK, I say, may come back to try others.
Brutal. Pizza was cold (literally) and we also ordered red velvet cake which came with a side of SOUR whipped cream (a first for me ). Very, very disappointed. Will not be a return customer.

Super impressed by the upgrades CPK has given to its menu!!! Especially with all the healthy options and variety for basically any kind of eater or dietary restriction! They are also super accommodating if you want sub something out or take it out completely! Friendly staff and great service! As someone who doesn't eat pizza often due to my choice of food intake, this was the first pizza I've had in YEARS and it was perfect! Hit the spot, light but filling, and great to split with a friend! In reality, the more accurate rating of this place is 4.5/5 stars!
We are from California and this is a taste of home. No complaints. Favs are pea soup and garlic cream fettuccini

Was shopping and kids started dad we are hungry. What's a good option with kids. California kitchen. Oh wait!! We were greeted at the door and the lady led us to our table. The waitress came and took our order, everything was fine till we got our food.  The food was here but partially, half the order did not show up, and most importantly there were no utensils to eat the food with. Looked around to get attention of one the waitresses but I was not successful. My wife saw a table next to us and said it had utensils. Went and grabbed it. But it was only two.  We were four and were on the hunt for another table with utensils. And we found one. What they do is they stack up plates and put utensils wrapped with napkins on them. I ran and quickly got it.  We all started eating but my wife. She ordered a salad but the dressing never came, she asked the waitress but kids and I finished as my wife was still waiting.  I said I am gonna go and get it, she said no, then I decided to go and get it, walked upto the bar and asked the barmen for salad dressing as he handed to me I saw the waitress approaching with the dressing.  So why 2 stars - the food was okay, the service - yeah definitely needs some improvement.

I LOVE this specific CPK!!!!  The food is always super fresh and delicious!!  My favorites are the California chicken club sandwich and BBQ chicken pizza!!!!  I usually meet my dad for lunch or dinner here and we always have a good time dining and catching up! We love the passion fruit sangria ( must try) The environment is usually crowded but still quiet to be able to have a conversation, always clean and the service is always good!  The managers are AWAYS walking around observing how their customers are being served and always come to you asking you if everything was good!  They really care about their customer service!!!  I will always come back here!

Mediocre food, serving is so little and so slow. Very poor customer service. What happened CPK? Surrounding extablishents have vastly improved on the way they treat their customers (e.g. Bahama Breeze etc). On my most recent lunch visit, which was a regular not-so-busy day: the woman who served our table was so unpleasant (as if we owe it to her that we are eating there), very rude and appears to be miserable with her work. There are more waiters in this location than customers but the service is very poor. You are better off eating at the food court.

I like pizzas there..This place has very nice dim light inside.  very good place for quiet time dinner. This place feels really amazing when having done with the long hours shopping too. every time i go i end up having amazing food here. good place and location too.
This place is like Pizza Hut on steroids. Simply amazing and sooo good.. I come here often and have been for the past 4 years.

Been here a couple of times. I could see that they added lot of good options not only to food but also to drinks, which stole my heart! Food is really good and they make really mean pizzas. Best Margherita pizza around.

Great atmosphere! After an evening of shopping what better way to end the night than to stop for pizza with your best friend! I ordered the BBQ Hawaiian pizza with grilled chicken... Man oh man was this Pizza good! The service here is very welcoming and friendly the staff made sure my friend and I were at ease and comfortable while waiting for our food. We were starving, but our waiter made sure we weren't getting impatient as he kept checking up on us. Overall I will recommend this California pizza place to my friends and family even strangers! Keep up the good work!

A good lunch place for salads, sandwiches, and of course pizza. My favorite thing to order is the California club sandwich with a side salad. It is very fresh with turkey, bacon, avocado, lettuce, and tomato on a ciabatta roll. The thin crust pizzas are also good but are kinda small. One time I go the fried mac and cheese balls and they were really bad because you could tell they were frozen. They were all congealed and stiff (not gooey and soft like they are suppose to be)
Short wait. Great service. A lot of smiles around the restaurant. And the food was to die for. Our waitress, Tatiana was very nice also.

First time here was very enjoyable. The host was very lively and funny and my server did a great job explaining the menu to me. From the name I thought CPK only served pizza but I was very wrong they have a variety across the menu. Would stop in again if im in the area. Hopefully they keep up the good service at this location, it goes a long way :)

You can always count on a warm welcome from the host Lory here. He is welcoming and efficient in getting you seated. He gives you realistic time frames and always has a smile on his face.  This location has a full bar and great service.  Always a great meal. Try the salads and pasts for some variety

Came here to grab a quick bite to eat while I was shopping. I was one of three additional tables with customers. There were literally more staff than customers - yet after almost 15 minutes no one came to my table to take my order.      I got up walked & out without so much as an acknowledgment. I'm only giving this review two stars because the food is decent. The service today was horrible.

My family and I have been coming here for almost 2 years now every other week or just at least twice per month. The host knows our family and they're very friendly. The food is as usual delicious however my last visit to CPK with my family wasn't as pleasant.  We get our table immediately (kudos) but our waitress did not come until 5-10 minutes into our sitting. When she came, she brought our drinks relatively quickly and we went right into ordering our food. The food took a bit longer than usual to come out, I'd say 15-20 minutes? [I don't want to peg an exact time, but it was in these ranges]. I ordered a Kung-Pow Chicken Spaghetti less on the spicy side. It wasn't as spicy as it usually was which is good. My father ordered a half sized roasted veggie salad however the asparagus wasn't cooked well. We told the waitress about it and she sincerely apologized about it. Here comes the good part. FLIES. Tons of them! So yes, the food smelled very appetizing but it should be the restaurant's job to do something about this! Sanitation? I don't know. But it sure bothered my family and two other tables that were around us. (They had it harder). I cannot stress this enough but please be aware of flies.  My review is between 3 and 4 stars but this incident has only occurred 3 times out of the multiple memorable handfuls of times I've been here, so 4 it shall be.

This place never disappoints! Great drinks, awesome apps and the best salad ever BBQ chicken salad. Server was quick and attentive. My friends all enjoyed their pizzas! They're "personal" pies but definitely enough for two people to share. Especially when you get drinks and an appetizer!

I visited this CPK on a weekend for dinner with my family. The wait, like any restaurant in willow brook mall was extremely long. However, I did not mind the wait. The host was hilarious and tried his best to keep everyone's spirits lifted.  I highly recommend the shrimp tacos that come with lettuce. It was DELICIOUS! My mouth is watering thinking about it. I also enjoyed the quinoa arugula salad.
Lory was quite the charmer of a host and Maggie very attentive waitress food as always delish, must have avocado rolls and the barbecue pizza oohh so good finish off with the tiramisu its is divine!!

Lory is the *BEST* host ever. Even if the food was awful- i'd return just because of his awesome customer service.  Lucky for me- the food is always great and the service too. Love the tri-color salad pizza  with extra shaved parm cheese and my husband loves the chipolte chicken (wish they'd bring back buffalo chicken).  CPK is always clean and has fresh food. I'm a fan! :)

$15 for a pie that only feeds one. I thought "Okay, that's fine, if it's good enough to justify, I guess they use better ingredients or something." Nope. I ordered the Hawaiin, I had to spit twice, once from a rubbery piece of chicken, and again from some kind of grit I still haven't identified but actually hurt my tooth. And that could be explained away by bad luck, but the final nail in the coffin was that it was just an under-cooked pie. The dough was floppy and there was no crisp to the crust at all. I'm usually not picky about these things, but this is the first time I've ever really regretted something as simple as pizza.  I don't understand how this place manages to stay open with at least three other quality pizzeria's near by. I don't think I'll be giving them a second shot.

Lots of menu options and I have enjoyed the small plates. I've tried the corn quac it was very good. The mac and cheese bites weren't what I was expecting, they weren't bad but I probably wouldn't order again. Chicken quedadilla is good. Can't go wrong with the pizzas. my friend got the lower calories option chili and said it was delicious and perfect portion size. I have tried the pesto pasta which was delish and the tequila pasta also quite tasty (reminded me of a pasta dish at cheesecake thougg which was a lot better but this one was still good on its own right). Prices are decent. Service can be hit or miss and their drink menu can use some new options I feel like it's a lot of the same ingredients. Desserts are delish as well!

Called in this morning to order an early lunch for pickup. It was before they opened and needed to have the food right when they opened at 11, so wasn't expecting them to be able to take the order. Luckily and VERY HAPPILY, Julio answered and promised my order would be ready right on time. He was courteous and really helpful!!!! Already LOVE THE FOOD but this type of treatment will have me coming back more often and telling friends how great they are as well. Thank you Julio!!!

This was my very first time inside of a CPK and I came specifically to try out their guacamole (cousin had been raving like a madwoman).  The portion was incredibly small - just a mini scoop of their guacamole and then some blue corn tortilla chips for dipping.  The guacamole is good, not the best I've had though (Chipotle's FTW).   The service was really quite lackluster - our waiter looked like he really did not want to be there and would much rather be snoozing instead. I am interested in coming back to try out their pizzas, looks like they have a great selection of different pizzas (different from the regular pepperoni or Hawaiian types).
I will never eat here again. I had questionable spin dip on Sunday and this entire week I have been sick. The service was friendly but the food should not be consumed.

Everyone knows that CPK has great, creative pizzas at reasonable prices. But what makes any CPK stand out? Service, service, service! And here ... the service is just not that good. In fact, it was downright annoying. I met my cousin for dinner; she beat me & already got a table by the time I arrived. I walked up to the host & explained I was meeting a woman who was just seated a few mins ago. "Oh, are you the party of two? She's over there," and he gestured vaguely to the right side of the dining room. You can't bring me to her table? Fine. I awkwardly scanned the dining room, staring at strangers eating, until I found her. So much for hosting, amirite? Our waiter was a combination of lazy & rude. He never asked if I wanted a drink; he just brought me water & asked what I was ordering as soon as I sat down. Each time he brought us more water, he left the empty glasses on the table. By the end of the night, we had 5 empty glasses cluttered around us. My cousin asked for cheese on her salad & he forgot it twice.  Halfway through our meal, and interrupting our conversation without an apology, he asked if we wanted dessert. When we said no (mostly because we were still eating dinner), he brought over our check!! We weren't close to finishing our meal, but we can take the hint: it's Friday night & since we're not drinking or getting dessert (yet), you want to turn our table. He looked confused when I asked for a box for the remaining half of my pizza -- did you think I was going to keep eating when you asked me to pay after eating 2 (of six) slices? We were asked to pay 35 mins in, & we stayed only an hour. My food was great -- and there's your second star -- but does that really matter? Between the hosts & the wait staff, it's really not the hassle. So the next time you're craving those delicious pizzas? Just drive the extra 15-20 mins & visit the Short Hills Mall or Garden State Plaza CPKs instead.
Consistent food and value.  Family friendly and great reward system with the CPK app.

To start off, we were seated right away, then waited roughly ten minutes for anyone to come to our table then another ten minutes for our drinks to arrive.  Secondly my girlfriend ordered a pizza which contained nuts and she is highly allergic and specifically asked to not have any type of pecans, walnuts or whatever it was that came on it.  The food came out in a timely fashion which was the only thing they did right.  Guess what they did, you guessed right they put the nuts on the pizza anyway and I caught it just as she was taking a bite!  If I had spent the night in the hospital taking care of her because basic instructions can't be followed, a lawsuit would have followed this review

The pizza is a lot better than I expected. The ingredients were fresh and that is a bonus for me. The wait for the food was a bit long to me but my son's food came out quickly. I'll stop by again if the wait at Cheesecake is long.

I love, love, love this place!!  I don't eat here nearly as often as I'd like because on any given Friday or Saturday night there's a wait and I'm the kind of person who doesn't think to go someplace for dinner until I'm already completely famished.  But when I do go, it's well worth the wait!  Also, their host who seems to work there every day of the week is extremely friendly and makes the waiting process a lot less painful.   I love that they have wheat crust pizza because not many places do.  The food comes out reasonably fast.  The service has always been pretty good.  And most servers play along with me while I try to recreate the one pizza I loved that they took off the menu (goat cheese, roasted peppers, caramelized onions and artichoke hearts....I'm in heaven!).  I'd also recommend the lettuce wraps or hummus as an appetizer- both are delicious!

The experience was mediocre, mainly due to our server not giving the best. Our food was lukewarm to cold at most. My drink only received only one refill, the only time when our food arrived. The manager was understanding of our situation, and gave us a discount and offered a complementary dessert, the latter which we declined. Mike, I hope you are seeing this review, whether you or your manager sees you. If you do not like the job that you do, then do not take it out on the customers who have no ill will against you. I hope you have a good night.
Great service, great food with a lot of Gluten free options.   Wish they could come up with a GF pizza though COME ON GET ON IT!
We got sat down right away today considering that many people have the day off for Martin Luther King Day. Then within minutes our server came over and we got our drinks and lunch was a pleasure.

Get the guac, so good!! I got their caramelized pear and onion salad, and def yummy except it was too much cheese. The half size is a good portion, get full if you plan to share. I've had their pizza before too, and surprisingly, it wouldn't be what I recommend the most. Super clean and chill vibe. Works well with low key night

I love this place, especially the big brick oven seen when walking in. Their pizzas are very good and so many varieties to try. I've had Thai, BBQ chicken, Pear n Gorgonzola, and Wild Mushroom.  Pricing is fair.

Meh. Well put Yelp, Meh.  Ambiance - 3 Stars: It's CPK... what do you expect.  Service - 1 Star: They're just not good. The guy who seats you is a bit scary, intense, and a bit intrusive. Some of the wait staff is okay, but generally they're rude.  The worst experience was when the chef left the kitchen after complaining about one of the dishes. One of the specials was a chicken stuffed pepper with cilantro and other fresh vegetables, sounds delicious right? Well it wasn't. When it came out we immediately noticed a strange smell. Oh well, give it a try anyway. It was gross. There was a noticeable taste of just bad. My initial reaction was that the chicken was either uncooked, or had gone sour. I singled out a piece of chicken, and it smelled awful - and tasted the same way it smelled. When we informed the waiter that we did not want to continue eating it, nor did we want a replacement - the CHEF came out. Why they didn't send the manager out is beyond me, and why the manager didn't prevent the chef from approaching us is also beyond me. He began arguing with me that I had poor taste, and that the "bad" taste we were experiencing was Cilantro. Cilantro does not taste like rotten meat, it tastes like soap. He continued to argue that the meat wasn't bad, which makes me assume even more that he KNEW the meat was bad, and served it anyway! After I couldn't take any more of his crap, I interrupted him - explained to him that it was extremely poor customer service to argue with a customer - and told him to leave my presence. A manager never came out to apologize for his rudeness.  Food - 3 Stars: Despite a few of the dishes we had there being on the rather - awful - side, I still had plenty of tasty pizzas. The Habanero Carnitas is one of my favorites.  Price - 3 Stars: I think the pizza is a bit expensive for what it is.

Haven't been here in ages. Came here today and was amazed at how quickly we got seated.  I am watching my intake of certain foods so I had a salad with grilled chicken, pears, and a balsamic honey vinaigrette. My boyfriend ordered (or rather I made him order ;) the california veggie pizza on honey wheat crust. Seriously...any pizza you get must be on this honey wheat they have! It's so damn good! I can't say it's great for that new diet your starting, but at least your palate will be pleased!

This is a nice restaurant especially for a place located in a mall.  Their service is very good.    But I don't care for their pizzas because I prefer traditional pizzas with tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese that can stand on their own without toppings.

I don't typically love chain restaurants, but my friend and I had a good experience at CPK this weekend.  The wait was about 25 minutes at 8:00 PM, which is NOTHING compared to the wait at the Cheesecake Factory (as if I even need to say that).  The host at CPK is a trip...he is silly as hell and he looks like Sammy Hagar.   Apparently their soda machines were not working, therefore we had to choose non-carbonated beverages.  No problem.  Water for me, iced tea for her. We split the sesame ginger dumplings for our appetizer.  They were a little under-seasoned, but the plum sauce that accompanied them more than made up for it.  I couldn't decided between a pizza and a salad, so being the clever broad I am, I opted for the tricolor salad pizza.  It's essentially the tricolor salad (mixed greens, tomato, and shaved Parmesan cheese) on top of a thin, Parmesan seasoned crust.  Sounds like it would be Parmesan overload, but it was excellent. My friend ordered some huge-ass salad that had everything you can imagine, right down to pears and walnuts (which she sheepishly said that there weren't enough of).  It seemed like the tables around us were waiting an awfully long time for their apps and entrees, however, all of our food came out very timely.  I kind of felt guilty biting into everything while our fellow diners looked on with envy. All apologies! Tatiana was our server and she was very sweet and attentive.  She didn't rush us and she kept telling us to please take our time upon receiving the bill.  CPK offers a full bar menu, and if I read said menu correctly, it looks like you can order a half-glass of wine (should you choose to partially imbibe).  A half-glass of wine is an appetizer for me, however, this might suit you lightweights out there quite well.   Not a bad choice if you're looking to grab a relatively inexpensive sit-down dinner at the mall.
Keep the Korean Barbeque pizza!! I love it so good :D spicy but not too spicy, cheese, delicious BBQ sauce and pork. Keep this one it's soo good!!
They have great food but the service sucked. Let's just say that after years of not eating at CPK this might be the reason why I stopped.

Worst CPK location ever. Every time I've gone they have always, without fail, forgotten an item and still charged full price for it. As many times as I say it's fine they were probably busy in the back they just forget, it still happens every single time. Lesson learned. I will never go here again.
What happened to this place? It used to be one of my fav chain spots. Went in today with my family and everything, starting from the service to the food was horrible..

service depends on the night and person you get.  food is pretty good i've tried their pizzas, pasta, and salads and have enjoyed everything.  pizza had margherita, meat lovers and roasted artichoke and spinach.  the roasted artichoke and spinach was amazing, the thin crust had a flat bread stick type texture and olive oil flavor, there were pieces of artichoke and the garlic really binded all the flavors together.  all salads have been delicious to note the california field one was the best.  it's seasonal but somrefreshing in the summer.  it has watermelon, strawberries, cranberries and feta cheese.  its not overpowering sweet and the feta cheese makess it savory.  ambiance is similar to any chain reataurant such as applebees or fridays but for a casual meal its great.

I have tried a few California Pizza kitchens around and the standard is always dependable and good. It's not a sophisticate place but the pizza and the appetizers they offer are quite interesting and delicious.  I really recommend this place, it's clean and the food, as I said, is good.

Love the Pear + Gorgonzola Salad pizza. Sweet, refreshing and addicting. The service and quality are always good. And love the fact you can call ahead to reduce your wait time a big plus for families when your out during the dinner rush.

I come here pretty often, and every time I leave in a good mood, the food is very good, the macaroni and cheese is the best macaroni and cheese I have ever had. The service is very good. Prices are great.

Normally I would give the place more stars, but our last visit was just ok. The service was ok, there was a lag in the food coming out of the kitchen.  The waldorf salad was good, but I've had better at this CPK.  They ran out of syrup for the iced teas and soda, so just ordered water. Was peeved because I love the peach iced tea. so, meh for this visit, will be a while before I return.

We also enjoy this CPK restaurant!  Even when they are really busy, the wait to be seated is never too long.  The wait staff are all really nice and the service is great!  Even when my really fussy friends go, they get the order perfect and there's hardly a wait.  Plus the pizzas are yummy!  I thought I was the only person to think the host guy looked like Sideshow Bob from Simpsons!  LOL. He's also humorous and good at seating people.

Place is going DOWN HILL fast...this once was my go to place.   Really not sure if I would ever go back.  They raised the prices on the pizza.  The entrees are overpriced and marginal portions and quality.  The management is not what it was and the foods quality took a bad turn !

went here for my fathers birthday. ordered the fettucini and was given thin spaghetti instead without even giving me an option for something else first. service was friendly but it was the waiters mistake not to offer me something else..was disappointed and prob wont go back

I've had the pasta here and surprise surprise it was nothing to write home about. The apps also are just ok and nothing super special either. But you know what when I think about this the first thing that comes to mind is the California Club pizza (doing the Homer Simpson drooling face) its the only reason I ever come here. Don't even know why I even bother looking at the menu since that's all I ever want, everything else is a bit of a crap shoot so YMMV.

MY ABSOLUTE, FAVORITE, NUMBER 1 GO TO PLACE TO EAT ANY DAY OF THE WEEK!!!  Just to give you an idea of how addicted I am to this place, EVERY waiter knows me by first name AND what my order is by heart! LOL. I honestly eat at this joint 3-4 days a week. I know I have a problem but I can't help it! I JUST LOVE IT!!  I have had almost everything on their menu but their hawaiian barbecue pizza and the barbecue chicken salad with the side of avocado and extra barbecue sauce are my absolute favorite!!  Their newly released small bites menu is really great too. I highly recommend the buffalo chicken bites. They are cheap and great for anyone who just wants to go out but doesn't want to eat a whole meal.  Every CPK has a liquor license which makes it even better! With a cocktail list up the wazoo you are sure to fall in love with a special drink or meal here.  They offer half and full sizes and just between you and me, the full size is maybe a quarter bigger than the half size and a good $4 more. A half will fill you no problem, no need to over stuff here! Salads are kinda pricey but very large and full. You'll spend about $12/$15 a person here for a drink and salad/pizza.  Seating style is very similar to a diner but nicer. Plush leather booths and tables and chairs. Full bar and brick oven pizza. All I have to say is YUMMM!!! You got my vote!!

I've been here a million times and the service is consistently really good. On occasion I have had a waiter who seems as if he/she rather be sleeping but they don't seem to last in this cpk. As for the pizza itself it is very good as well. I usually don't really care for franchise food however they do a good job here. The stuff always tastes fresh as well.  My personal fave is the BLT pizza.  For some reason I LOVE their brownie sundaes. Actually am having one right now as I write this review... This is my lunch lol and yes I know the brownie is microwaved!

Have liked this place since I first went in college. The pies are different enough to merit a trip now and then (totally worthless to pick something "ordinary" though). Love anything with goat cheese, and my wife is nutty about the mushroom pie (even I think it is awesome and I ain't crazy about mushrooms). The price for a pie is ~$11, which is the same price for a meal at any of these chains anymore. I'll put it this way, when I go to the Willowbrook Mall (rarely these days) I go here. Which says something I suppose. Oh and the host has been there for years; he looks like Sideshow Bob, too.
Although the place was almost empty mid-afternoon, service was still uneven.  Pasta dish arrived cold, and when sent back to be heated, came back very dry.   See no reason to dine here again!

Ended up here because The Cheesecake Factory had too long of a wait. Pizza was good, service was so/so, Nothing special but as an ex-waiter I'm not going to be too harsh. The host remembered our name on the way out, I don't know if that's good service or going a little too far.

Two stars for the food and low rating for the service!!!! This is about our recent visit to the restaurant. We are regular CPK customers. But the last experience was a turn-off. The waitress, Monique, was arrogant. The food came out late...20-30 mins after we placed the order. After we were done with the food, Monique took another 10 mins to get the dessert menu. Dessert came 15 mins after we placed the order. The topper was - we ordered Thai crunch salad (veggie, no meat) and what came out looked like half plate. Upon asking Monique said that because there is no chicken, the amount is small!!! You charge us same as the regular salad and give us half the amount?!! Overall a very bad experience!!!  I hope the management does something to make us change about mind about your location!

I've eaten here only ONCE and it was about 3 years ago but I WASN'T IMPRESSED ! It seemed to be very average to me and the portions were a little on the SMALL side [of course,MY idea of small is ALOT different than alot of other peoples,lol ! ] . Seemed a bit PRICEY for the amount of food they give you too. The WORST thing is that the pizza was FAR FROM GREAT ! I see here alot of people like it but they won't be seeing me again too SOON !

If all you want is a regular pizza, you are better off going to your local pizza shop (especially since we are in the NJ/NY area!) Don't get me wrong , the pizza is ok and is better than a Pizza Hut or Domino's pizza but, for this area, it is nothing that will make your mouth water when you think of it.  There are speciality pies here you will not find at your local shop,I mean how many places have a Jamaican Jerk pie or a Pear and Gorgonzola pie? But the real gems are some of the salads. I recently have had the Miso Seafood Salad which was superb. There is a light but very tasty miso dressing and a plate full of chinese & red cabbage, avocado, daikon, edamame, carrots, onions, with chinese noodles & wontons. Even the half portions are large and I needed a doggy bag to take home the leftovers. We went on s Sunday about 5pm and went right in with no line. Service was fine and there was no rush to get us out as you sometimes find in a place like this. If you are interested in a salad and maybe splitting a pie (as in pizza)  with someone, and you don't mind dining at the mall, give it a shot. It is better than a lot of the fast food places in the food courts. This particular one in Wayne is in the main Willowbrook mall entrance that faces Route 46, to the left of Sears as you are driving towards the mall.

I personally like coming here for the specialty pies. I always get the same either the Santa fe, Carnitas, BBQ Chicken or Jamaican Jerk. As mentioned before this isn't the best place to find expectational pizza but a good place to hit when I'm bored on a weekday. They also have curbside pickup which is pretty handy when its real cold or your in a hurry. I usually call them up before I leave work and its ready. Service has always been good too. But I do have to say their seasonal Pumpkin Cheese cake is delicious. So good! I'm not a soda person so its great when they have real homemade lemonade on the menu.
service was a little slow and they make all their servers memorize their orders so because i asked for a slight tweak the pizza came out wrong. Other than that though great food!

Whenever my girlfriend and I go to Willowbrook Mall, we usually go eat at the California Pizza Kitchen. CPK is always good and this time was no exception. The only problem we had this time was the noise level, but that was because we were seated next to a table of 15 young kids out for a Bday party. CPK is a very social place, so am I not really upset at this problem. For an appetizer, we always get the lettuce wrap because it's semi-healthy. The lettuce wrap is always consistent and a good way to start your meal. For dinner, I tried something new this time. Usually I'd get the BBQ Applewood Smoked Bacon pizza, but this time I tried the new Habanero Carnita Pizzza. Warning on this one, the sauce that is provided on the side is very very hot. My girlfriend got her usual of BBQ Chicken Avocado salad and that was spot on as always. In regards to service, our waitress was very friendly and very energetic. As usual, dinner was good at CPK.
good, consistent pizza not worth the price of almost $20 a meal though
